column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 3 Chinese prosecutors have launched a criminal bribery investigation into a former senior executive at FAW Group Corp  a Chinese partner of Volkswagen AG  and Toyota Motor Corp  China's procurator said on Wednesday.

column4: Australia new vehicle sales slip in August-VFACTS
column5: SYDNEY  Sept 3 Sales of new vehicles in Australia fell in August from July but were still on track to top 1.1 million for the year as a whole  industry data showed on Wednesday.     The Australian Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries' VFACTS report showed sales of 88 157 in August  down from 89 867 in July. In seasonally adjusted terms  that equated to a fall of 0.5 percent.     Sales were down 5.5 percent on August last year  though partly due to August this year having one less

column4: Verizon to pay $7.4 million over failure to notify consumers on privacy rights
column5: WASHINGTON Verizon Communications Inc will pay $7.4 million to settle a U.S. investigation that found the company failed to notify properly some customers of their privacy rights before using their information for marketing  U.S. regulators said on Wednesday.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Baird hires financial adviser  branch manager from Wells Fargo  RBC
column5: Sept 3 Baird said it hired a financial adviser and a branch manager from Wells Fargo and RBC Capital Markets  respectively.

column4: Yum estimates China same-store sales fell 13 percent due to food safety scare
column5: Yum Brands Inc estimated same-store sales in China fell about 13 percent in the third quarter and continue to decline  hurt by a food safety scare in late July when a former supplier was said to have used expired meat.

column4: UPDATE 1-Yum estimates China same-store sales fell 13 pct due to food safety scare
column5: Sept 3 Yum Brands Inc estimated same-store sales in China fell about 13 percent in the third quarter and continue to decline  hurt by a food safety scare in late July when a former supplier was said to have used expired meat.

column4: Yum estimates China same-store sales fell 13 pct after food safety scare
column5: Sept 3 Yum Brands Inc estimated same-store sales in China fell about 13 percent in the third quarter as a results of a food safety scare in July when a former supplier was said to have improperly handled meat and used expired food.

column4: Zoetis granted conditional license by USDA for PEDv vaccine
column5: CHICAGO Zoetis Inc has received a conditional license from the U.S. Department of Agriculture for its vaccine against a deadly piglet virus and will begin selling it this month in the United States  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Zoetis granted conditional license by USDA for PEDv vaccine
column5: CHICAGO  Sept 3Zoetis Inc  the world's largest animal-health company  has received a conditional license from the U.S. Agriculture Department for its vaccine against a deadly piglet virus and will begin selling it this month in the United States  the company said on Wednesday.

column4: Hungary's Richter  Palatin Technologies sign drug license deal
column5: BUDAPEST  Sept 3 Hungary's Richter and Palatin Technologies have signed a license agreement to co-develop and sell a drug called bremelanotide in the EU  other European countries and additional selected countries  the companies said on Wednesday.
